Trump confirms the CIA is conducting covert operations inside Venezuela
subhed: Asked on Wednesday why he had authorized the CIA to take action in Venezuela, Trump affirmed he had made the move, also stating that the administration 'is looking at land' as it considers further strikes in the region. Trump declined, however, to say whether the CIA has the authority to take action against President Nicolás Maduro.

title: In Peru, the scourge of insecurity is fueling a political crisis
subhed: The wave of violence linked to organized crime has cost President Dina Boluarte her seat. Bus drivers, shopkeepers and artists have been the main victims of extortion, and on Wednesday, they are set to protest alongside the rest of the population against a corrupt system.

title: Philippe Aghion, 2025 Nobel in economics laureate: 'The key factor of economic power is technological leadership'
subhed: The French economist was part of a trio that won the 2025 Economics Nobel Prize. In an interview, he argued that France and Europe must invest in innovation to maintain their status as economic powers.

title: First Wap, a discreet cyber-surveillance firm tracking journalists, public figures and corporate executives
subhed: Little known to the public, this long-standing player in the surveillance industry has been selling phone-tracking technology for more than 20 years, including to authoritarian regimes. Among its targets: a journalist investigating the Vatican, an Airbus employee, and Hollywood actor Jared Leto.
